title: Calories in Ahi Tuna
meta_description: Discover calories in ahi tuna per 100 g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for raw yellowfin tuna.
assumptions: Raw ahi tuna (yellowfin tuna), sushi-grade, no added seasonings or oils.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fish freshness, cut, preparation method, and sourcing; consult labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of raw ahi tuna contains about 108 kcal and 24 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged seafood.

tweaks.label: Seared (lightly cooked) with 1 tsp sesame oil per 100 g
With soy sauce marinade (1 tbsp per 100 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in ahi tuna per 100 g?
faqs.a: About 108 kcal for raw ahi tuna.

faqs.q: Is ahi tuna high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, 100 g provides roughly 24 g of protein.

faqs.q: Does ahi tuna have carbs or fat?
faqs.a: 0 g carbs and only 1 g fat per 100 g raw.

faqs.q: What's the difference in calories for cooked ahi tuna?
faqs.a: Lightly seared adds minimal calories; grilling without oil increases to ~118 kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: Is ahi tuna low in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, raw ahi tuna has about 36 mg sodium per 100 g, but marinades can increase it.
